I've sampled most of the tacos, apps, and soups, but still have yet to get over to the specialties side of the menu, although it looks delicious. I just can't seem to tear myself away from the tacos alambre. Today's visit featured the delicious and simple fideo and aforementioned tacos alambre obsession. It returned me to life after a crappy morning.A couple of warnings for the faint-hearted: the tortilla soup is not the usual stuff your abuela made or that you can get at Taco Cabana or Chilis. It's dark, it's spicy, it's flavorful, but it will definitely be a surprise if you're expecting the lighter version. Also, as some reviewers have pointed out, and something that also remains a mystery to me, despite the authenticity of the food and overall great flavors, the rice is so terrible. Like utterly bland and dull and unexciting terrible. I'm sure it starts off with the greatest of intentions, and I'm aware that even simple dishes like rice have their own territorial or familial recipes and variations, but at the same time, could ya get a little more flavor there? Maybe a bit of garlic and more chicken stock? It really is a generic Mexican Tio Ben's rice there and it leaves me dumbfounded every time. I expected that in New England, but not in Texas.One last gripe: the parking. I don't think it's been covered, but the parking situation can be a little weird. The parking lot itself is too small for the restaurant, so if it's a peak time, you're going to be navigating driveways and sharp turns behind the restaurant. There are signs warning everyone about NOT using the overfill parking, and although we've yet to be towed for using the closer lot on the side, I'm still about erring on the side of caution at times. So be prepared for a hike in the back parking lot if it's lunch or dinner rush.Next time I go back I swear I'm ordering a specialty dish. And good riddance to the people who thought Taco Bell was better.

Reviews.Author: Heather L.
Reviews.Content: Guajillo's is a great place to get authentic mexican dishes. Their salsa is mouth watering and spicy. I also love their tacos and fideo soup. Lots of flavors and spice here.

Reviews.Author: Eddie G.
Reviews.Content: I always try to make a stop here on my trips to SA.  Delicious, authentic Mexican food. Margaritas and micheladas are great too.

Reviews.Author: Erik F.
Reviews.Content: Authentic Mexican!!!  Tacos were the best!!

Reviews.Author: Diana D.
Reviews.Content: Yup, good one if you want to get close to real mexican food. Let's be honest, you can't get the authentic taste of a kind of food if you are not in the REAL place!!  Who's with me?  Anyway, Guajillo's is good, really good.  My favorite is the chilaquiles de pollo and fideo soup, and the salsa almost like my mom's salsa, yum!    The Agua Frescas are  not the best approach to the real thing but close enough.  And to response to Heather's (one of the earlier reviewers) we not only have roaches in Mexico's restaurants, but so much better you can get a rat to bring you your drink and stir it for you!   Freaky huh!  Enjoy....

Reviews.Author: Lina R.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING. Service wasn't bad and the food was great! I hate corn tortilla, but this place made me like it now. This is authentic as it gets.

Reviews.Author: Hari N.
Reviews.Content: Salsa is straight from heaven...So nice with right amount of spices to create a full body flavor. It has infact won the best salsa award. They just have one salsa unlike many that carry 2-3 types of sala. This is one of the few places that serves Cochinita pibil. Their soup is decent, and Chilaquiles is very nice with the salsa. Surely a must go place. The staff was very nice and the food came out so fact, that you were not kept waiting for anything.

Reviews.Author: Lin C.
Reviews.Content: Not your typical Mexican food...or what you think is authentic Mexican food. I'm not a big fan of Mexican food (too oily for me), but the food here is amazingy good that I'd eat here again and again. My friend brought me here and had promised me that they served authentic Mexican food. It's not your average Tex-Mex place. I had a steak taco, and was surprised that the taco didn't look like what I had expected. I mean it came with a few small tortillas and beef on top of it. You can add cheese for an extra charge, but my taco tasted fine without it. The beef has so much flavor. The prices are reasonable and the service/staff are so friendly and upbeat.

Reviews.Author: Adri H.
Reviews.Content: When I have gone more than a few weeks without it.....my mind wanders to their hot sauce and guacamole constantly until I have my fix.....First timers must try their albondigas (meatballs of goodness served with rice and beans) and their tacos (be sure to add cheese and no rice or beans come with).  Their fideo is the soupy perfect kind that you will also dream of later.  Do not think San Antonio typical Tex Mex when you come here or you will be disappointed.  Their margaritas and cheladas are awesome and so are the prices.

Reviews.Author: Gerardo B.
Reviews.Content: Take it from a Mexican, if you want authentic Mexican tacos this is as close as it gets in this side of the river. Simply delicious.

Reviews.Author: Elle H.
Reviews.Content: The service was fast and friendly. I tried the enfrijoladas and due to them not using lard and other additives it didn't feel like a bowling ball in my stomach after the meal was over. This also is the reason I think it sort of lacked flavor. I will say that the salsa that came with the chips and salsa at the beginning of the meal has an amazing flavor and a nice kick (salsa is very important). Maybe I should have poured the salsa onto my meal...another huge plus is that I paid $6.95 for my plate rather than the usual $9 plates at most other restaurants.

Reviews.Author: Derek C.
Reviews.Content: Who am I to say whether or not a Mexican restaurant is "authentic". I always tread lightly when I see people with limit experience in a country declare a restaurant serving food from that country "authentic".  But on the merits of the taste of the food, this place is a wonderful surprise. It certainly isn't the Tex-Mex we are used to. The Tortilla soup was a simple broth with tortilla chips mixed in. Not the chicken and alvocado variety, but delicious and simple. The salsa that came with the chips is fantastic...once enough taste buds on your tongue die and you can actually sense the flavor of this HOT concoction. And the tacos. Once again....simple. 6 mini taco shells topped with marinated pork. They include a plate of onions and cilantro on the side for you to  add to the taco. Delicious. Americanization and watering down of ethnic foods, like Chinese and pizza, is very American. And now they are commonplace we take these foods for granted (ever hear the saying that there's no such thing as bad pizza?). By keeping things simple and supposedly close to the real deal, Guajillo's makes you rethink Mexican food and develops an appreciation of all the wonderful cuisines the made their way to America over the years. Don't take the word of some hipster (or me, for that matter). Come and try for yourself.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: I've gotta say that Guajillo's is the closest to true Mexican food that I've had on the north side. The thing I love about the menu is that they combine tradition seafood dishes with tradition beef and pork dishes. So no matter who you're with they'll find something tasty to eat. When I went I got the Chilaquiles de Pollo which was outstanding. Thinking about it now makes me want to go there right now. I also love getting the little tacos. It reminds me of this great taco stand I used to go to. As far as drinks are concerned I agree with Trey. The margaritas are ridiculously delicious and strong. I would HIGHLY recommend going to Guajillo's.

Reviews.Author: Alex A.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best hot sauce and tacos de bistek in town and possibly beyond.  I've never had a bad meal here since I first learned of the place several years ago.  This is not Tex-Mex so don't expect greasy enchiladas on the menu.  The beans, made without lard, also are my favorite in town and I've eaten a lot of beans in my day.  Micheladas and fideo are also very good.  I've had several other dishes but just can't remember then names right now.  In terms of authenticity and the quality of food, I'd have to say this is one of the better places in town.

Reviews.Author: Juan N.
Reviews.Content: I really like Guajillo's.  The food is really tasty.  I love the sopa de fideo and the cochinita pibil.  Inexpensive and tasty.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for old school tacos, they have the best salsa and chips in San Antonio I recommend the Al Pastor. Great for the price.

Reviews.Author: Monica M.
Reviews.Content: Do not come here if you are looking for Tex-Mex.  These are MEXICAN dishes from the south of the country.  I have had almost everything on the menu and can't recall a dish I didn't like.  My absolute favs are the albondigas, mole, and cochinita pibil.  If you are coming here and want the best out of it, order a traditional plate.  You can get tacos with meat anywhere!  The food is fresh and I never get a plate dripping in grease.  Great, fresh combination of flavors that you do not have in Tex-Mex cuisine.  The staff has always been extremely friendly and accommodating.  My favorite Mexican restaurant in SA so far.

Reviews.Author: Karla H.
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for some authentic food!  Growing up with homemade Mexican food and then moving to SA for university proved very difficult. The restaurants here always had bland (non spicy) salsa, and offered a limited number of things. I love their Sopa de Fideo and their Aguas Frescas, especially because they have Jamaica. They offer queso fresco and their beans don't taste like they were from a can. It reminds me of home and I am now in love with this place!

Reviews.Author: Derek S.
Reviews.Content: GREAT FOOD, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.  When we pulled up we were unsure as the place looked a little run down, but once you walk in the front door, you will know you made the right decision.  Very clean place.  Best Mexican food I have had in years and I live on the border.  English speaking staff provided great customer service.  Every time my 18 month old dropped her spoon, they were their within seconds to provide a clean one.  I don't usually write reviews but felt this place really deserved another one.  This restaurant will be a regular stop on our San Antonio trips for now on.

Reviews.Author: Mark W.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this restaurant. I discovered Guajillo's on a Wednesday for lunch just after arriving into town. I ended up eating dinner there on Thursday and then brought 4 customers there for lunch on Friday prior to heading back to the airport. Everyone absolutely loved the food. The service was great and the prices are very reasonable. If you are in San Antonio, check it out, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Bronwyn W.
Reviews.Content: I'd been hearing for a while that this place was pretty good. I needed a quick and cheap dinner option one night and talked my bf into this place (he'd been before and seemed to enjoy it). Glad I had a coupon... Chips and salsa... good, but not noteworthy in a city full of free chips and salsa. I got the soup with the shrimp and guajillo pepper-- totally tasty (spicy!) broth but shrimp were obviously large salad shrimp as opposed to anything of entree quality. Those were the only 2 components to the soup... so one being lacking makes the dish suffer tremendously. I then moved on to enfrijoladas--not awesome. The beans had good flavor and the cheese was good (I got one with white and one with yellow), but the whole plate was room temp at best. I didn't want to be bothered with flagging down my waiter again, so I just ate cold food. Dessert was rice pudding, which was okay, but nothing to write home about. Better than Kozy Shack cups from the store, but not by too much. Margarita was drinkable, but not something that I'd order again for flavor or buzz-catching purposes. Service was totally late-night dive style--not too bad or good. Would be back only if others in a group really wanted to go.

Reviews.Author: Marisa P.
Reviews.Content: Guajillo's makes some amazing tacos.  The gringas are more quesadilla style with just enough pork greasy goodness to soak into the tortilla.  The bistec taste great with lime, cilantro, and onion.  The taco servings do not come with any sides, and are more like "mini tacos" with 6 to a plate.  Plenty of spicy soup selections to nurse a hangover.  The aguas frescas help rehydrate.

Reviews.Author: Kristina M.
Reviews.Content: Sick of the usual Tex-Mex? Guajillo's forgoes the usual San Antonio staples and offers some delicious specialties from interior Mexico.  Although I try to sample more things off the menu, I typically order the Chicken with Mole Verde (also available as a vegetarian item with zucchini substituted).  It is absolutely incredible and served with lard-free, but very tasty refried beans.  The house salsa is flavored with habaneros and has just the right heat.  Chicken Tinga, served with pickled red onions, is another favorite, along with their LA style al pastor tacos.

Reviews.Author: Sara Z.
Reviews.Content: Found out about this place on a list of best tacos in America.  Well, we have had better, Tacodeli in Austin was on the list and should have been on the list.  This was the worst of the best that we have had.  Had we never had the best we would have loved it.  Confusing?  In other words, it was pretty good, but definitely wont be your favorite taco.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food from the interior of Mexico.  The tortilla soup is excellent along with the selection of lunch specials.  One of the best lunch bargains in town.  I love that there is no yellow cheese this is real Mexican Food not Tex-mex!

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: This place was just 'aight' for me, I probably just ordered the wrong dish or went on an "off" day.  The chips and salsa were tasty, the corn tortillas did not seem homemade (for a place that bills itself as truly authentic Mexican food, you'd expect homemade everything).

Reviews.Author: john g.
Reviews.Content: First visit. Service was excellent. Waiter was very friendly and attentive, even though busy with lunch crowd on a Saturday.I ordered the Chicken A La Mexicana and my friend ordered Bistec (mini tacos). I also ordered a small bowl of fideo soup as an appetizer.Ouch..the fideo soup was very, very salty which was a shame, because the broth flavor was great. I can usually handle oversalted food, but this was a bit much.Now for the main entree. I was disappointed with the chicken flank. It was dry and had burn marks on it, which led me to think it may have been reheated. The salsa on the chicken was okay and didn't have any "heat" factor, even though menu describes sauce as having serrano peppers.Plate includes rice and beans. The rice was disappointing, as it was too light and not much flavor. The refried beans were just fine, as they were fresh and had good flavor. The corn tortillas were not good, as they tasted like bulk pkg style. My friend  who is never critical of anything or anyone, briefly opined that the bistec tacos were not good, so I can't elaborate on her opinion without any further detail. As we exited the restaurant, my friend told me that she noticed a sign stating that they use "healthy" style cooking and ingredients. Maybe that explains the shortcomings I observed. The best part of this experience was the waiter. He was awesome and I tipped him very well for his positive attitude towards all customers and efficient delivery. Unfortunately, I don't plan on returning. There are just too many other choices in this great city for great Mexican or Tex-Mex.

Reviews.Author: stephanie w.
Reviews.Content: I recently came here with a girlfriend after a small splurge at the mall. We were looking for something easy, quick, delicious, and inexpensive. Not an easy task. Then Janie remembered Guajillos and their inexpensive taco plates. We immediately turned the car around and headed in their direction. Upon arrival we were immediately seated and promptly tended to. Our waiter (I did not ever catch his name) was nice enough and very attentive to our needs. The place itself is nonassuming and very plainly decorated; however, they were not crying for business. I knew I would be in for a good meal. The chips and salsa, oh the chips and salsa. What a heavenly combination! Thick cut, freshly fried tortilla chips sprinkled with salt and lime. Smokey, delisciously spiced salsa.... oh, it was like walking on sunshine! I could have eaten a few dishes all by myself. In hindsight I wish that I had asked for some to go. I ordered the bistec tacos and Janie had the pork carnitas with cheese. When Janies arrived she was slightly disappointed that the cheese on the tacos was more of a runny sauce than shredded cheese, but they looked good none the less. The one thing I did find somewhat strange though was that the meat was cooked separately from the onion and cilantro. Instead, the condiments are served on the side. For this reason I felt that the meat was a little undereseasoned. The plate consisted of six corn tortillas and a heaping pile of thinly cut beef. The beef was also slightly dry/chewy which I chalked up to the lacking of prep time with the veg. With the addition of all the acoutrmonts (to include the heavenly salsa), they made for some extraordinary bites :) Janie's pork carnitas were scrumptious but I made her scrape off the cheese sauce. By the time I tasted one the cheese had developed an odd, congealed texture which did not look particularly appetizing. The meat was very flavorful as hers had been cooked along with onion and peppers.  I also ordered a side of refried beans. They were a little salty, and heavier than I'm normally accustomed to; I ate them all none the less. For under $10 this was truly a fantastic meal... I will be back again.

Reviews.Author: sara c.
Reviews.Content: fantastic food: excellent guacamole, salsa, bistec, pastor.service is a little off and the place could be cleaner.i wouldn't recommend any mixed drinks but grab a mexi beer and some mini tacos!also try the fideo soup. So flavorful and unlike the texmex fideo casserole. This is an actual soup that is so tasty!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan S.
Reviews.Content: Great place.  Very good margaritas.  The green mole chicken is off the chain.  Salsa is quite spicy, but good.  Highly recommend as a departure from Tex-Mex crapola.

Reviews.Author: Wes K.
Reviews.Content: This is one of two my favorite places in SA. I always get the chilaquiles, they are awesome. The tortilla soup is the best I have had. The salsa is really hot but I can't get enough of it, my favorite salsa. Half the time I get some to go. I miss this place living in CA now.

Reviews.Author: Vol T.
Reviews.Content: The salsa is so tasty! It's unique and stands out in a city oveflowing with salsa. I like the chips as well. I have only been to lunch, and what I've had I've really enjoyed. The fideo that comes with lunch entrees is so delicious! Citrus-y, whifch I love. Servings are quite small (I like manly portions), but it's perfect for those days you want to eat more healthy. The owner tells me they make everyhting from scratch with quality and fresh ingredients. I believe him! Because I can certainly taste it in the food. I think this place is unique, and the food as well. I take their word for it that it's shortcut to Mexico since I've never been. But I imagine it would taste like Guajillo's.

Reviews.Author: Foug C.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome, go there.

Reviews.Author: Ronda L.
Reviews.Content: Had the mole verde, chicken and chipotle dish, and tacos. Awesome! The "refried" beans aren't fried--aren't even cooked in lard--and they're amazing! The tacos are like taco cart or street tacos i've had in Mexico. The place may not look like much, but it's incredible. Probably the best authentic Mexican food I've had in San Antonio, and that's saying something.

Reviews.Author: Ene K.
Reviews.Content: The Enmoladas were awesome. We're LA transplants and this place does Mexican right!!

Reviews.Author: Ron B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Mexican food and not Tex Mex.  The chilaquiles with steak were great. Salsa is spicy and very good as well, I'd have to say some of the best salsa I've had.

Reviews.Author: Megan R.
Reviews.Content: I love authentic mexican street food, and this place was a little disappointing.  For starters, the person who recommended it made it seem like a San Antonio Tex-Mex joint, so my family who hates really spicy food, was a little frustrated when we sat down and everything had some unfamiliar spices they weren't willing to dive-in and try.  We were sat in a back room all by ourselves and the waitstaff didn't speak any english, which is usually a good sign for authenticity, but this was just an overall failure in communication as our orders weren't exactly what we ordered.  Meh.

Reviews.Author: Cassie H.
Reviews.Content: The tortilla soup is delicious. Also, the Gringa tacos are pretty good, too. Tasty food for a great price!

Reviews.Author: Angela P.
Reviews.Content: Seriously sublime! Everything is fresh and amazing; but the fideo is out of this world. Superior value; great service and tasty mango margarita's make this a frequent destination for me and my husband.

Reviews.Author: William C.
Reviews.Content: Salsa will clear your congested sinuses! Just the way i like it. Bistec tacos are great and pollo tinga is good with a little bit of a spicy kick

Reviews.Author: Angelica G.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely ridiculous delicious food!!

Reviews.Author: Dov H.
Reviews.Content: The Mole Verde was very good. Not mild, but not overly spicy either. A nice mid range of fire. The tortilla soup was a bit on the salty side.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy O.
Reviews.Content: Good price and great food, must try

Reviews.Author: Kate G.
Reviews.Content: Came here after getting a rec from our server at Dough, and I had such a good meal! Their salsa is hands down one of the best and by far the spiciest I've ever had. I couldn't stop eating it and ended up putting it all over my food. It was a bit too hot for some at our table but that just meant more for me. It even helped spice up the guacamole we ordered, which though delicious, lacked any heat. I ordered the poblano quesadilla on homemade corn tortillas ($2.95). I groaned audibly multiple times during my meal. It was plenty spicy on its own but crazy spicy with the delicious salsa piled on top. In spite of my burning mouth, I ate every bite of fresh tortilla, melty white cheese and charred poblanos topped with some fresh-squeezed lime juice. I also ordered a side of rice and beans which were way more than I needed for one person, but the rice was sooo flavorful, I was glad I ordered them. I mixed the rice, beans and salsa together for a spicy, yummy and very messy plate. So so so good. I can't wait for a return trip and I will try the fideo soup when I'm back and hopefully the tacos. And margaritas! This is definitely authentic Mexican and not tex-mex, and that was just what I wanted.

Reviews.Author: Margaux G.
Reviews.Content: We go to Guajillo's at LEAST once a week! the tostadas de picadillo, salsa, and fideo are AMAZING! Also, the waitstaff remembers what you like.

Reviews.Author: Allix S.
Reviews.Content: In San Antonio there's a TON of Mexican food to be had.  As a northerner, I probably wouldn't be considered qualified to determine what is authentic Mexican food.  However, this place was f*cking amazing!!  My husband got the chicken with green mole, which was spectacular, and a mango margarita that was so good I wound up stealing half of it from him.  I don't remember what I ordered was called, but it was absolutely delicious and actually felt like I was eating something that was good for me! Everything was really fresh and the flavors were intense (fair warning the salsa is really hot).  It was the first time I've walked out of a Mexican restaurant not feeling like I need a good workout to balance it out!  The only reason Guajillo's isn't getting a perfect rating from me is that the service was a little spotty.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: Good food, good service.  I had the  Mole Verde Con Pechuga de Pollo, which was fantastic.  My wife had the Enmoladas de Queso and that was great too.  We are looking forward to going back and trying other items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Quinlan E.
Reviews.Content: 1st night in San Antonio traveling from SF and the food was amazing.  The real lime juice margaritas and the chicken mole were incredible.  The ceviche and the pork soft taco (el pastor - 1st one on menu) was delicious too.  Love the service. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Author: Nancy D.
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: After our last return, I must hand out 5 stars, and I am stingy with my stars!  Once again service was very attentive and helpful.  At the owner's suggestion, I ordered the chicken in green mole; husband had the Mahi Mahi again (we have been feigning for it!). The sauces this place puts out are so complex and fresh they put fine dining establishments to shame.  I am not a fan of mole but this sauce was nothing like your traditional, chocolatey fare.  It was seasoned with cilantro, pepitas, green peppers, and secret goodness.  The owner also brought two soups to our table: fideo and tortilla soup with additions of cheese, roasted peppers and avocado on the side.  How do they get so much flavor in there without the usual suspects of lard, bacon, etc?!  Until next time, visions of sauce and soup will dance in my head.......

Reviews.Author: Cate W.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great place for mole and other treats!  It's a nice break from the usual Tex-Mex fare, with all sorts of authentic Mexican dishes.  The "shortcut to Mexico" is a great description...a few minutes drive gets us to a place that reminds me of the Mexico I remember (Yes, remember when it was a beautiful, safe place to travel without worry?), with food that never disappoints.

Reviews.Author: Jean C.
Reviews.Content: Service was amazing.  The food was VERY tasty as was the salsa.  If you are expecting the normal TEX-Mex food-do not go here.  But if you are looking for something a little different and not bland this place is great.

Reviews.Author: Sarah D.
Reviews.Content: If you're not a fan of traditional mexican food (not tex mex) then you should stay away from this place. I went to meet up with a friend here, and having passed it more than once, I was excited to try it. The chips and salsa were good, but the food was not. I'm not used to traditional Mexican food, so please don't rely too much on my review. However, I thought the food was bland, tasteless, and quite possibly, the worst thing I've ever eaten. I will not be visiting here ever again.

Reviews.Author: Marisella P.
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin.. We LOVE guajillos! Everything! The fideo, the spicy shrimp soup ( can't think of the name right now). I always order the enmoladas, as a mole lover you can't go wrong. Also, how can I forget.. Their salsa is amazing!! Tortilla soup is yum, my boyfriend always gets the tacos de alambre and they are great too. Guajillos is a must!

Reviews.Author: Paul N.
Reviews.Content: Omg the salsa is hot. This is the first time I ever had authentic Mexican food. the food was good but we prefer Tex Mex.

Reviews.Author: Marc A.
Reviews.Content: Nothing Tex Mex about this place. I eat at Guajillo's when I am hungry for real Mexican food. The food is spicy but oh sooo good. The menu has all authentic dishes from throughout Mexico. Kuddos to the wait staff who provide excellent service. Guajillo's ranks as one of my favorite San Antonio restaurants.

Reviews.Author: Shannon M.
Reviews.Content: I want to marry the fideo. So good.

Reviews.Author: Ana P.
Reviews.Content: My absolute FAVORITE restaurant in all of San Antonio! Seriously. I came here after running the Rock n' Roll Marathon a few years ago, come here on birthdays, dates with my boyfriend, family lunches and dinners, most special occasions in my life are celebrated here! Here's why: BEST and most AUTHENTIC Mexican food you will ever have in your life, FRIENDLY and FAST customer service, and owners who genuinely care about and remember their customers. It's a family owned business! Favorite things on the menu are the Enmoladas (enchiladas made with queso fresco and mole sauce) **ask for them with chicken! it's not on the menu, but you can order it** and also love the Bistec Tacos w/Cheese (thinly sliced steak, topped with cheese, served on about 7 small corn tortillas, with a side of cilantro and onions that you can add to your tacos as you eat). Their SALSA is the BEST in all of San Antonio--SPICY, just how I like it! LOVE THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Author: Patty C.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of  the best authentic Mexican food restaurants in the city!   I love Guajillos because there is nothing like it anywhere in the city. Too much of San Antonio caters to the traditional "Tex-Mex" styles of enchiladas, fajitas, chalupas..etc. Guajillos gives you something different and truer to the tastes of central Mexico.  Their salsa is unlike any other.  Its tangy and hot not overrun with tomato sauce like most salsas.  They have great lunch specials that come with your choice of soup tortilla or fideo and a entree for a very fair price.  I personally have had everything on the menu and no one this has disappointed.  My favorite and what draws me back is their tortilla soup.  It is an absolute favorite. It has no bells and whistles but is absolutely mouthwatering.  Its just broth, tortilla chip strips, and cheese. Very unique compared to what you get everywhere else that serves it anywhere.  The alambre tacos are also very very good just sprinkle a little of their hot suace and they are perfection.  My second favorite it the cochinita pibil which is spicy tender stewed pork dish.  Warning its a little on the spicy side if you do order it.  For dessert they have one of the best tres leches cakes I've ever had.    They are family operated and really nice group of people.  Have always offered opinions on what to try next. Overall I highly recommend a visit if you want something off the tradional "Tex-Mex" blah you find too often here in San Antonio. Really good Mexican food at a family owned establishment.

Reviews.Author: Sandra L.
Reviews.Content: Food is good, not great.  The price you pay for so little food is almost insulting.

Reviews.Author: Dave B.
Reviews.Content: Yesterday on a whim my Wife and I left the house on a mission to "eat at a place we have never been to".  After a frustrating drive around town we finally came accross Guajillo's "The Shortcut to Mexico".  Immediately upon entering we were welcomed by our waitress with an entire breakdown of the menu, including recommendations... each one of which sounded more and more delicious.  Next thing we know we were greeted by the Owner of Guajillo's who graciously took the time to detail the background of his recipes, his ingredients, and made suggestions which we did not hesitate to take.  I ordered the Mole Poblano (Chicken Breast with Real Poblano Mole Sauce and Roasted Sesame) and my Wife ordered the Tinga de Pollo con Tostadas (Shredded chicken, onions, and chipotle sauce).  AMAZING.  The Mole Poblano sauce is one of the most different and DELICIOUS sauces I have ever had, it's complex yet smooth.  I highly recommend.  My Wife's meal was just as delicious and authentic - we swapped plates several times!  Big thank you goes out to everyone at Guajillo's!  WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!!

Reviews.Author: Chris D.
Reviews.Content: My lady and I dined here this past Sunday night (9-5-2010).  She ordered tortilla soup, which was delicious.  I ordered the poblano pepper and shrimp soup, which smelled HORRIBLY unfresh.  I took one bite, and could not eat it.  I asked if they could take it back to the kitchen and give me the tortilla soup instead.  The waiter told me the manager would not refund me for the $3.50 soup I had ordered, but he would be happy to give me anything else I wanted.  Our alambre tacos were very good, and the tortilla soup was great, but the whole issue with the other soup and the management's unwillingness to refund me for a measly three and a half bucks left a bad taste in my mouth.  It's too bad because this place came highly recommended by a friend who lived in San Antonio.  We don't live in San Antonio, we were only here for vacation.  Needless to say, when we come back, this place will definitely not be on our list of places to visit.

Reviews.Author: Scott A.
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Guajillos; overall good experience.  Food was definitely  not typical San Antonio Tex Mex.  If you like Taco Cabana (and you shouldn't) you will probably not enjoy this food. $5.95 lunch special includes tortilla soup or fideo. DRINK NOT INCLUDED.  I bold this because the coke i ordered was around $2.00. I had the tortilla soup; good, but not the best i have had.  My colleague had the fideo and she loved it. Main course was CHILAQUILES CON CARNE ASADA and it was great! I would definitely recommend trying this plate.  The only negative I have is the tortillas, they are not homemade, the waitress said they are factory made.  A place that advertises as "a shortcut to mexico" should have fresh tortillas. Aside from the tortillas, a great place, it will definitely get more of my money.

Reviews.Author: Don V.
Reviews.Content: I was impressed I usually don't like authentic Mexican but this wasn't bad. Would I go back probably not. Salsa was really good but hot the way I like it and the menu didn't have Burritos etc. I wish that they would add a mild salsa also for some people because I noticed a lot of people stay away from the salsa.

Reviews.Author: Mark B.
Reviews.Content: Guajillo's is one of the best Mexican(not Tex-Mex) restaurants in San Antonio.   The tortilla soup is excellent.  The Mexican style tacos (bistec, al pastor etc.)are also very good.

Reviews.Author: Carlos G.
Reviews.Content: Go there for lunch. They have good lunch specials and they are quick at getting your food out in time. It may look busy but don't let that discourage you. Oh and try their fideo!!!!

Reviews.Author: Bruce J.
Reviews.Content: When we sat down i got the manditory chips and salsa and the salsa was really good.  So I figured at this point the food was going to be special... well not so much.  The fiedo soup led me to believe that there are a bunch of yellow boxes in the kitchen to be opened.  The tortilla soup was ok but it was all soup and not much else.  When the food arrived I was ready for a diffrent kind of mexican food and It was diffrent.  I have been to many taco restraunts in SA and I have never had mexican rice like this.  This rice could only be matched by Rice-A-Roni.  The meat was ok and the corn tortillas were above average.  I can now see how the lunch special was $6.95.  When they call it a shortcut to Mexico I had no idea that the shortcut was store bought prepared products rather than fresh made product.  Concept is good, price is ok but we want homemade not shortcuts.  Thats the last time I take a New Yorker's opinion about whats good in Texas.... Get a rope or get fresh
